intro: Tithymalus obtusatus, commonly known as the bluntleaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Tithymalus obtusatus is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
